website_summaries.verdict: This simple poncho works well for those wanting a reusable product with a neutral design.
pros: Offered in a few different colors and styles
Extremely lightweight constructions allows for easy portability
Can also be used as an on-the-go blanket and hammock tent
cons: Not as breathable as advertising would suggest

customer_reviews.title: Flexible
customer_reviews.text: Great poncho. Better material that I thought it was going to be, lots of room to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: ~:(I)

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, good budget option
customer_reviews.text: It's breathable as a poncho and fairly easy to set up as a tarp if you know what you're doing. Mine comes in at 8.4 oz. Definitely a good choice for a budget rain gear/shelter combo.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: The umbrella vendors hate me now!
customer_reviews.text: I was traveling internationally a week ago in Italy where deluges were expected and wanted to have something that packs smaller than a rain jacket. Unless you have complete confidence, it is totally goofy wearing it in the city and I was wearing it over some nice clothes. Then it started to rain. I was so happy at how well it kept me dry and warm when it was bombing down rain. This poncho will work well when I want it to cover a small backpack hiking this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Frost

customer_reviews.title: We got hit with a massive thunderstorm and these ponchos worked great in keeping us and our gear dry
customer_reviews.text: My son and I used these on a recent backpacking trip in Virginia. We got hit with a massive thunderstorm and these ponchos worked great in keeping us and our gear dry. The rainproofing on my tent wasn't working so I used some cord to attach the poncho to the top of my tent as an additional rain fly. Versatile, useful, light weight, and packs down tiny. Great product. My only complaint is the flimsy Velcro attachment points. My opinion is that I'll end up replacing them sometime soon.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lasecki

customer_reviews.title: Caution
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the less expensive models which were rip stop nylon (you can tell by the checkered pattern in the fabric). I liked them enough to buy one of the more expensive version with the neck closure. This more expensive version was NOT rip stop nylon, merely nylon taffeta. I don't understand why they would not be made of the same material. I'll keep it for light use, won't be as durable as the less expensive model though.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product company and customer service. I'm a bigger guy and both models fit me well. Both are incredibly premium ponchos. The bigger green poncho is by no mistake the upgrade of the two models. More lightweight and breathable, plastic stiff brim of hood, and zipper at neck. Not a fan of the color still but it's to protect you from the rain not walk down the runway. I would buy it again and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Super light, versatile and hilarious when wearing a pack
customer_reviews.text: This poncho was awesome on our backpacking trip on the Olympic Penisula in Washington state. It was raining constantly for one of the days. the poncho mode keeps you dry and we used the tarp mode to elongate our existing tarp over our packs. First time using a poncho in a while but I'm a complete convert and bought a second one for my wife when her rain jacket started leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended. Light weight too
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah. I'm 6'2" and this poncho fits plenty big .....used it twice since the rain season began in Florida...highly recommended. Light weight too
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cvercko

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Durable Rain Protection
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is super lightweight and durable. It was the perfect protection from the cold rain in Patagonia. It was big enough to fit over me and my 70L hiking bag, the Velcro tabs secured the poncho below my arms, and the metal rings at the bottom were a great addition so I could put a carabiner through or even a safety pin to prevent the poncho from blowing in the wind. Because the poncho wasn't structured, I was able to fold it into a compact pocket of my hiking bag when I wasn't using it, and even opened it as a picnic matt to sit on the wet ground. Awesome color, too.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of gear!
customer_reviews.text: Long wet hike. Guess who stayed the most dry. This guy. Easy to put on without taking your pack off. I paired this with gaiters and a rain kilt and hiked through a downpour with brush close on both sides. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Butler

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere,  do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a few short hikes as a poncho after work, in the rain for maybe a few hours each time. Did not keep me dry at all. It actually seemed to soak up the water and then condensate on the inside. Also there are no snaps on the side, just really cheap Velcro. Never did use it as a tarp, mostly as I couldn’t imagine staying dry using it. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Whitty

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, lightweight, stores well.
customer_reviews.text: Kept me dry during a 2-hour long walk in the rain a few weeks back - worked great. There are only two suggestions I'd make: 1. Consider integrating the bag into the poncho itself. 2. Provide some mechanism (or instructions) to help roll/fold the poncho up so it fits cleanly into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Hadfield

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Bang for your Buck
customer_reviews.text: Finally busted this guy out during a moderate rainstorm to walk to work. Less than a mile from home, I was soaked up to the crotch of my pants, up to my shoulders, and around my entire chest. The only part of me that stayed dry was my back. I eventually took the poncho off, threw it in the garbage, and just walked in the rain without it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you're an adult!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if your an adult male. I'm sure it's a good poncho for women or kids but if you're an adult male the poncho is way to short and small. Hood won't even come up over my head.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, light, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This met my expectations for a poncho. It's pretty baggy, but that's part of the design so you can wear it over a backpack. It was comfortable to wear through an extended downpour and didn't get soaked. I only removed 1 star because it has a plastic visor that's presumably supposed to keep drips off your face, but it came crumped from the stuff sack and wouldn't flatten out enough to be comfortable or useful. Still, I was able to make it work in conjunction with my hat.
customer_reviews.author: KC Baltz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome awesome rain coat
customer_reviews.text: I really really like this rain cover. It’s so huge. I use it on my electric skateboard for riding in the Pacific Northwest weather. It has brought space for my bag as well and a head flap for keeping the rain out of my eyes. It also has an option to use buttons to make sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This poncho worked nice. I purchased it for sitting outside in the woods and it did the job perfectly. It does have a slight “new smell” to it when opened but I let it hang outside for a couple of days and it seemed to go away. Anxious to see how it holds up over time in its carrier pouch, but at the price if I get a few years out of it, it was worth it. The Velcro arms held nicely, and it was noises when moving but not as noisy as expected. I don’t have a picture because well, it is what it is... a poncho! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: The right choice.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, lightweight and truly waterproof poncho! I am so glad that I chose this model of poncho! It kept me dry during torrential downpours and I used it to bolster the waterproof capability of my tent. It was the right choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisbythelake

customer_reviews.title: Disneyworld and more!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I had the fortune of traveling to Disneyworld during hurricane Dorian. We experienced massive torrential downpours for 10-15 minutes at a time. The poncho served its purpose well and was discretely stowed away after each use. I highly recommend this! As a hiker/backpacker, this poncho is perfect for the ultralight types and also serves as a tarp. I did not use it as a tarp, however, but after examining the snaps and grommets, this item looks promising. This item is not as heavy as the poncho I was issued in the military but it has a very similar form factor. Look no further, this is the poncho for you.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof at all.. a heavy rain and you'll be soaked
customer_reviews.author: walrusbones

customer_reviews.title: sturdy poncho with upgrades
customer_reviews.text: We live on the volcanic slopes in Hawaii where it rains almost daily, so we needed a poncho to get the mail, get to the car, work in the garden, hike the trails, etc. This fits all sizes and sheds water appropriately. It snaps up the sides to prevent intrusion. The hood has a drawstring and a sun visor. Can't speak to how it would perform in a high wind or over a pack. The carrying case makes the poncho very small and portable but we just hang it on a hook by the door.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph H. Goldsen

customer_reviews.title: Good to go.
customer_reviews.text: The purchase of this poncho was the result of a great deal of comparison in material, size and price. I bought two ponchos...one for each of our bug.out.bags. The material is lightweight and strong. The small pouch into which it packs belies the size - sufficient to provide shade and shelter...and fit over a backpack. These ponchos will fit in a day pack, a glove box in a car or the pocket of a windbreaker or parka. At the price, one for each member of your family without busting a budget. In my opinion and experience, buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Cover Arms, Not Good for Biking
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I'm past my return window, but this poncho proved to be useless for bike commuting. First of all - those arm holes leave your arms out in the open all the way to elbows. Second - as you bike, wind blows it away off your knees and this results in wet legs. I tried to use the straps at the bottom of poncho to attach it to the handlebars, but they don't stay in place at all. All in all, I'm 6'2" and even for me this poncho is super huge, flapping in the wind leaving my legs and arms soaked. Not sure why they even sell it with open arms like that?
customer_reviews.author: Maxed

customer_reviews.title: Good ponchos
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were really impressed with these. Good quality material, sturdy construction. I liked having the little bill on the hood. We wore them recently in FL, and while they're definitely still stuffy in that kind of heat and humidity, it was better than my rain jacket or other ponchos I've had in the past. I'm 5'10" and it covered me to my lower shins. My husband is 6'4" and he still had plenty of coverage, too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: You want to be at least 5 feet 8 inches tall to wear this poncho as it is long
customer_reviews.text: The Anyoo poncho is a vital piece of equipment for me as I work outside in the rain a lot. It is lightweight, waterproof, comfortable, and the hood works well. The only drawback to the design is that it is wide and tends to snag on objects if you walk too closely to them. Other than the width and subsequent snagging issue, I would highly recommend this poncho.
customer_reviews.author: William Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great value on a nice poncho
customer_reviews.text: My main concern at this price point was durability. I was pleased to find the poncho made of lightweight, but durable fabric. Similar in weight to a sturdy tent fly. I'm sure it 'could' be snagged or torn on thorns or sharp branches, but for normal use it should hold up really well. I am about 5'8", size was ok, didn't feel like it was going to drag on the ground or anything. Lightweight and rolls up small in the included case. This will stay in my outdoor essentials bag.
customer_reviews.author: runawayralph

customer_reviews.title: Hood is made of the wrong stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard lightweight poncho, which is good. It comes with a little stuffsack. Unfortunately, they made the visor out of a hard clear plastic that creases easily, and retains the crease. I'll probably end up cutting it off. Also, the second edge snap on only one of the two edges is a curiosity: it can be used to compensate for the girth of a front pack by lengthening the front of the poncho relative to the back, but there is no matching snap to shift length towards the back to compensate for the girth of a backpack. Very curious placement indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Odsmaker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing poncho
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing poncho. I’ve never been a poncho guy but I bought it for when I go camping and hiking. It’s incredibly lightweight and water resistant. I’ve had it for over a year and I’ve beaten it up and it’s still good as new. I used it as a tarp on one of my camping trips and a huge thunderstorm passed through the night. I was expecting it to be torn apart especially along the seams overnight but when I woke up the next morning it was completely intact!!! This poncho is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Design and Quality Construction!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is not another crappy plastic emergency poncho. It is made of the same rip-stop material tents are made from - very light and super tough. It's also quite versatile, due to its large size and thoughtful design. I'm extremely happy with it; cannot find a bad word to say. I have one in each bug-out-bag, and will probably buy more for vehicles/travel/gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Christian C. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Water "resistant", not by any means "rain proof"
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for a few minutes, but this soaked through within half hour. Keeps the big drops rolling off, but slowly seeps water through. Used this at Disneyland for a day in the rain, with a jacket that I knew to be only water resistant, and having this poncho on the outside, I was soaked through. Poncho does also cut the wind, so at least I was "luke-warm but damp". If you really want to stay dry, or are using this in real outdoor situations, I'd definitely steer clear of this. I would have returned them, had I not foolishly cut the labels off already...
customer_reviews.author: David A. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these ponchos while laying in my little teardrop camper during a downpour, needing to get to the bathhouse asap, and realizing my rain jacket was 15 feet away in my car. I wanted rainproof and compact enough to leave in the trailer for moments just like this. They arrived in a day, are sturdy ripstop nylon. I haven't tested the waterproof ability yet, but they look like good tent material. The poncho has a hood that hugs the face and on my 5'3" frame comes nearly to my ankle. I think they are a great bargain at the price.
customer_reviews.author: skiwoman

customer_reviews.title: This will definitely keep you dry!
customer_reviews.text: I've been to a few MLS and international soccer games this summer, and they do play in the rain! This kept me dry through security, and let me sit in rather wet seats without issue. It's small and light enough to take hiking as I've been caught by the rain a few times this rather wet summer. Great poncho!
customer_reviews.author: J. Budzik

customer_reviews.title: it's very waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: it was a little heavier than I expected but it is lighter than some other rain jackets. it might be to hot for summer but for spring/fall rain or a SoCal Winter it's perfect. I mostly wanted a long jacket that would also keep my butt dry in addition to everything else. I've also used it to run a 5k in. although it's too effective at keeping the rain out it also holds the heat in, so I was pretty steamy in a torrential downpour during the race. and yes I was still dry except for the sweat from running.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Keough

customer_reviews.title: Kept me and a table full of food dry
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a tailgate that we knew called for rain. We had tents and that kept us dry for most of the tailgate, however, when it really started to rain, our table with food on it started to get wet. I took off my Poncho, and spread it out over the entire table of food. IT KEPT EVERYTHING DRY! No water got in, and when we went into the game, it kept me bone dry there too. This is a great product. It isn't made of cheap plastic that will tear easily and let water in. I would buy this product again, but I dont think I will ever NEED another one since i have this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Spadin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Reasoning for giving one star all the way through is because it’s a super cheap material. The snap on button fell out on the very 1st snap. Haven’t tried to see if it’s really waterproof. I went ahead and purchase a better quality at REI for my sons hiking trip to make sure he had no issues. I kept this one as a extra on camping trips. Unfortunately this one was not good. I was expecting/hoping it would be.
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA

customer_reviews.title: Good poncho
customer_reviews.text: I have only had a chance to wear this once and wore it to a football game where it rained the entire game. The poncho worked well and I stayed dry the entire game. I suggest wearing a baseball cap to keep the hood up and out of your eyes. This is a common problem with any poncho I've worn. I would recommend this poncho.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I did like it but, The hat have a clear plastic the make your life hell
customer_reviews.text: I did like it but,The hat have a clear plastic the make your life hell. It is fall on your eyes and it wrinkles. It was better if it just wasn't there. I must say that I was thinking before I bought it that the material will feel heavier but it feel chip. Hopw it will stay with out hols for a wile. I love that in the neck there is a zipper it does make life easier to put it on.
customer_reviews.author: Yael M.

customer_reviews.title: Used once so far
customer_reviews.text: Now, it doesn't rain much in Southern California, but I wanted a poncho that would cover both me and my messenger bag I use to transport my food and water for my day's work at the office. I got in this thing with my bag and I looked like a giant avocado! But I stayed dry except for my face.
customer_reviews.author: Milford

customer_reviews.title: It works as a poncho.
customer_reviews.text: The "neck" is a bit too long, and makes the whole hood stick up farther than it should, making it awkward to wear. Fine I guess if you have a long neck, or if your parent was a giraffe or something. The material is lighter than I expected, which is great for light use, but I would not trust it as a ground cover or as a tarp if it was going to be windy. Material gets a lot more pliable when it gets wet, which does make it easier to fold back up after it dries.
customer_reviews.author: Knubinator

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, but very large for me
customer_reviews.text: I am small (5'4" 115 lb), So the sleeves go past my hands quite a bit, and the whole thing looks super big on me. But I still wear it. And it's very waterproof. It's the kind of waterproof that if you're sweating on the inside, the inside is going to get more and more wet. So it's kind of good that it's roomy on me. The hood is very effective in keeping rain off my face. The whole thing definitely fits a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Firebird

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Walking (and Singing) in the Rain!
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is constructed using a sturdy plastic that is also lightweight. I live in an apartment and have two dogs. Taking them for a walk and trying to hold on to an umbrella at the same time became like a juggling routine. So I purchased this hoodie poncho and it works great. No more problems walking dogs in the rain. When I get back to apartment I take off the poncho and shake it a bit to get rid of rain drops and then hang it in my utility room. Highly recommend this product. Definitely recommend this Anyoo brand poncho to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: F. Figueredo

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal-Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I wore these rain ponchos all day over our back packs during the rain. They kept us dry and water did not drip into our faces. There was plenty of room to move our arms and the sturdy side snaps kept them in place. I am 5’ 4” tall and wearing the orange poncho. My husband is 5’9” and wearing the dark green/grey poncho. The ponchos were not too long or too short. They come with stuff sacks to make packing easy. Today was a test run as we are taking the ponchos on the 500 mile Camino de Santiago hike in Spain on April 23. We would recommend these ponchos.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon P

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I tried this rain jacket out in a descently hard rain pour. The jacket is well made and fits great for me and I'm 5'11 and 360 pounds. The only issue is the Velcro strap on the sides that hold the jacket close make it hard. To keep close and keep arm holes in wind can cause the frount and back to flap in the wind getting you wet. Pre warning it takes a couple min to put on right even in front of a mirror makes you wish they had an guide to help.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Pickard

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact can fit in glove compartment
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight easy to roll up back into its carrying case bag. It has places for you to tie down if you’re going to turn into a shelter it has snaps on the side so water doesn’t end up going through the side. The material feels like he can take some abuse. It’s a good quality doesn’t feel cheap and I’m leaving it in my vehicle for those sudden downpour is that happened during the rainy season in Florida. I will update if I find any issues during the rain storms.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Camera & I stayed dry all through Ireland
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a 16-day trip to Ireland. It rained every day we were there (of course) but my camera stayed nice and dry under the poncho all through the trip. I particularly like the snaps that secure the "wings" to the wrists. I also appreciate the fact that the poncho is sturdy and strong. And I like the fact that it is big enough to go over a backpack. Very good product, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M.

customer_reviews.title: Overall good value, could have been great.
customer_reviews.text: Its waterproof, basic design, good length and coverage even on my 6'3 and well padded self. For the price it works well, the beak on the hood is adequate. The description mentions hook and loop fasteners, they are in fact plastic snaps that do the job, but could have been better. The snaps are arranged so they will only close when in poncho mode. Simply swapping male and female along one side would have given it a sleeping bag and jacket mode at no additional cost. No pockets either which would have raised the price slightly but increased the value more IMO. Maybe for the next version.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, stayed dry
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this Poncho a 5-Star Rating because it works exactly as a poncho should. I used it cutting up fallen trees in the raid after hurricane Michael. The material is very quality, no tears, no leaks, no issues. I like that is was large enough to accommodate my backpack as well. Its also light wait, I will definitely bring it backpacking and kayak camping.
customer_reviews.author: ben14

customer_reviews.title: Awkward For Hiking
customer_reviews.text: This poncho provides good cover and it is lightweight and compact. It is OK for casual use but not hiking. I took it on a moderate hike and it caused me to trip several times because of its length and looseness. I prefer better fitting rain jacket and rain pants. The plastic visor is a really bad idea. It gets kinked in the package and makes it difficult for the head cover to fit properly. I had to cut this visor out.
customer_reviews.author: azimmeister

customer_reviews.title: This ponco will be just what I need on a rainy, windy day.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I sometimes vacation in places that can be rainy and windy. Umbrellas do not work in this kind of weather. For me, this poncho is perfect. However, for my wife, who is only 5'2", it was too long. The poncho could be a little lighter and pack into a tighter bundle, but that would make it less durable. It does seem like this poncho will rip during normal use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Busa

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry
customer_reviews.text: Used to set up camp in the rain and it worked great. The material is thick and made well, and I never got wet. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: talsharden

customer_reviews.title: Get this ponch
customer_reviews.text: I'm so very pleased with this poncho. It doesn't make you sweaty like plastic or tarp, it folds down into it's little bag well. I use an ancient ALICE pack that likes to snag ponchos and the material slides right over. I can't recommend this enough. A nice woogie underneath and you're good.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Negrey

customer_reviews.title: Best $16.00 I've spent in awhile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this poncho about a year ago specifically to walk our dog. This is the first year we've spent all winter at our condo in SC and it's been a rainy one. It works very well, keeps you dry. Had our pup out during a down pour and kept me dry except for my legs below the knee...it was windy so nothing would have stopped that. The sides snap in about 3 places on each side. I caught it on stair rail and it popped the snap off, so I would imagine, I'll pop more off over use...but I'll probably buy another. Works well enough and for the money you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: slr456

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget backpacking poncho
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and waterproof. The carry case is not durable and ripped easily but I normally just roll my poncho and stuff it in the outer mesh pocket of my backpack so I have no use for the carry case. It's one of the better budget ponchos out there but I would purchase something more durable if you plan on using it often. I just use it for summer backpacking trips and it's perfect for that. If you plan of using it over your backpack (I don't) it will leave your legs unprotected so I recommend pairing it with a cheap rain skirt.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua McGlothlin

customer_reviews.title: Great protection from heavy rain
customer_reviews.text: I work outside in some very serious weather. This stood up to the test better than my very expensive rain coat. Offers great coverage, plenty of room to move around. I had a hard time getting the hood to stay up in fierce wind, but it wasn't a huge issue. I love that it zips and isn't just pulled over the head, and that I can just hose it if when it's dirty. Really wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: The shake dry feature works
customer_reviews.text: I received the Anyoo coat just in time to use it in the rain. I am very pleased that I could bring my rain poncho indoors immediately without dripping all over floors and carpets. I just shook it for a few seconds and all the water shook off. I then went inside with my coat folded and rolled it up and put it on the table where I worked. No papers got wet. the desktop stayed dry. I'm glad I got this coat.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Fabric feels cheap and it’s sized for a GIANT
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper fabric than I’d hoped for. The outside feels nice but the inside feels kinda cheap and sticky. I was hoping for something smooth on both sides. Also, it’s absolutely enormous, which makes it look pretty funny on me (I’m 5’7”). Will work for an emergency (will probably keep it under the seat in my truck), but not nice enough to wear for hikes in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: elfling

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for backpacking. It was small and light weight, easy to pack. And it kept me dry during a rain/hail storm!
customer_reviews.author: Steph Higley

customer_reviews.title: Gonna Buy another one
customer_reviews.text: Although I've not worn this in the rain yet, it seems well made and packs up nice and small. I will very likely order another one or two to carry in my boat and car.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Looks a bit silly, but works well!
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use this product for backpacking and hiking. It's large enough to cover myself and my pack, and it does a great job at keeping even a heavy downpour out. I initially tried to use it while riding my bike as well. However, I found that it is too baggy for this purpose - the wind catches it and slows you down, plus there is risk that it will get caught in the bike gears.
customer_reviews.author: B. R.

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: I just received this when I had to open the package and wear it to keep from getting soaked by stormy weather. Kept me dry from the calves up. The wind kept blowing the rain onto my lower legs as the poncho fluffed in the wind. Still, it kept me completely dry. Lightweight fabric-style design. Definitely keeps the water off. Need a way to anchor this to my legs in case of another gale-force wind.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency poncho!
customer_reviews.text: It's extremely lightweight, but ripstop and waterproof. Also, the grommets make it easy to convert to a shelter. I'm 5'4" and it seems like it'll easily cover me and my daypack. Haven't used it except a quick stand in the rain, so I'll update review if this changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Farber

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use
customer_reviews.text: While hiking, it began to sprinkle and before the rain started I pulled out my new poncho and put it on over my pack, snapping the snaps to secure the flapping edges. When the rain stopped I reached back to unsnap the poncho and it ripped in two directions, rendering the poncho unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Jack A. Mullin Jr

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: I got this poncho to replace a sturdy Coleman poncho that we lost after many years of use. What a bummer. The plastic visor was bent and can't be straightened. The first button that I tested tore off with minimal pressure. Another button was missing the back part it's supposed to snap into. The material is thin like an umbrella - seems like it would blow all over the place in the wind instead of hanging straight down. Tall people might like it because it's long, but it's not built to last, so I will keep looking for something better. The blue color is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Little Lilly

customer_reviews.title: It kept me dry. It folds into a tiny ...
customer_reviews.text: It kept me dry. It folds into a tiny ball and fits in a small bag. I keep it in my car for a rainy day at work.
customer_reviews.author: david frenette

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's Boy Scout summer camp. He was gone for a week and needed to have rain gear as they always end up getting hit by some kind of summer storm. I wanted to get him something he could use to cover him and his pack, or whatever he was carrying. He told me it worked really well. Hes also an 11 year old boy so he enjoyed calling it his reaper cloak and it was really fun and useful for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Bought for 11 year old boy. It works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 11 year old son for Boy Scout camp. He's 4' 6" tall and the poncho is a bit long for him, but if he uses it with a backpack underneath, it will be perfect. The material is light enough that we could fold up the hem and secure it with duct tape, if necessary. He refuses to wear his Frogg Toggs because they are uncomfortable, but doesn't mind this poncho at all.
customer_reviews.author: C. Inks

customer_reviews.title: Anyoo Rain Ponchos: A Great Choice For Rainy Days And Nights!
customer_reviews.text: Checking our weather back near the beginning of the year, I saw we had a good amount of rain activity heading our way. I went searching for rainwear with something a little extra. Anyoo’s rain ponchos looked like what I was hunting for and turned out to be exactly what I needed. The material and lining makes them sturdy, yet still lightweight. As a tall guy, the length works too, providing excellent coverage. I absolutely recommend these ponchos. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: K'lee L.

customer_reviews.title: Compact but light duty.
customer_reviews.text: Compact but lighter duty. Full zipper front. Hood is good size. Roomy. Easy in and off. Snaps are very small. Length for my 5’7” is shorter, not more coverage than a 3/4 coat. Fabric would not hold up well as tarp/tent or ground-cover in harsh conditions. If you’re walking the pet it’s probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: It kept me and my pack mostly dry through 2 days of constant downpours. I couldn't get it snapped well so it would shift on the windward side. That side got much wetter than the rest of me. I'll still carry it instead of a jacket and pack cover. I'll be adding some Velcro though.
customer_reviews.author: B. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: For dire (desperate) emergency only or windbreak.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like anything about this product. Second rate. Looks hideous. It’s cheap plastic. Waterproof yes but for standing around only because it’ll be hot. Threw it in a dark recess of my four wheeler in case someone needs something to keep out of the rain or wind. Cannot use it for active hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes H. Benink Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Kept me dry at a rainy NFL game
customer_reviews.text: I wish it came in NFL Team colors, but the green was my College Team colors, so for many the color is perfect... it's light weight, but sturdy, allows for easy movement and access to pocket in garments worn under the poncho. Good Value.
customer_reviews.author: Desert KnuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: Top Of The Line
customer_reviews.text: This is a great poncho. It is very light weight and incredibly roomy and does not cause you to get sticky wearing it. Its length keeps you dry below the knees (I am 5'6") and its overall size makes it large enough for a one man lean to if camping. Buy it with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Neverhome

customer_reviews.title: super light weight
customer_reviews.text: looks great, and super light. really nice and big too. It may be too big for smaller people? I am 5'8, 160lbs, so i am not that big but I do love the fact it is big. It keeps me dry from the rain. I do sweat under it but that is expected (I ride my bike to commute so i use this in the rain on my bike). I am actually thinking about getting a couple of more in different color/pattern to give to my friends
customer_reviews.author: John Galloway

customer_reviews.title: good and simple
customer_reviews.text: it's easy to carry in the carrying bag, very light weight. It could use another set of snaps/buttons on the bottom or two as it tends to bellow out a bit too much when it gets really windy. It has a little plastic clear visor thing along the hood, found it useless as a visor, but folded into the hood it actually helps hold the hood in place when its windy. it is very easy to put my backpack on and take it off underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Markos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Poncho!
customer_reviews.text: This is not your cheap run of the mill poncho! It is made of quality material, has a hood with a tightening strap and armholes for movement. We had a torrential downpour while in the Galápagos and I took it out of it’s small zipper bag, threw it on and was dry as a bone!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy reusable poncho
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this poncho for my son for an upcoming trip to an amusement park. It is nice and heavy, definitely more substantial than I was expecting for a reusable poncho. It provides full coverage and I like the fact that it has real pockets. He will also be able to use this for camping trips for Boy Scouts.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof but not for windy weather
customer_reviews.text: Great poncho/tarp. Just remember that this is meant for rainy weather, not windy weather ;) as you can see from my photos, it did not do well with wind haha. It just kept flying in my face :) but for the brief moment I wore it it was waterproof, had a cute design and it was also super light to carry and very easy to fold back unit the pouch
customer_reviews.author: Nessie

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight poncho of decent quality. I live in Florida so the weight of this poncho is perfect. My only issue is how well it'll hold up to use in heavy brush. Still quite happy with purchase. I'm 6'2" and 265 pounds. Poncho is plenty roomy but only comes down to just above my knees. You could not wear poncho over a pack. Be happy to answer any questions for you.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Helms

customer_reviews.title: After extensive research, I went with this one.
customer_reviews.text: After getting soaked two trips in a row I couldn’t afford to get soaked again. Looked into a variety rain poncho and after extensive research, went with this. Glad I did! It is light weight and compact, I keep this in my bag full time now , just Incase there are rain showers while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Somoza

customer_reviews.title: Good adult size!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my husband, for a European trip. He hasn't used it yet (he only tried it on), but was very happy with the length and amount of coverage it provides. It was easy to refold it and put it back in the pouch to fit nicely in our suitcase! I hope it lives up the the water proof part!
customer_reviews.author: pavlicek

customer_reviews.title: The only poncho you need for amusement parks!
customer_reviews.text: Great investment! They protected us from the rain at Walt Disney world! Very comfortable and are adjustable with buttons on side! I’m a size 22 and it covered me up perfectly, my sister is smaller and it was perfect for her as well! Didn’t rip like the plastic ones do, easy to pack back up and reuse again!
customer_reviews.author: jessica garza

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy! Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Great poncho! Bought this for a recent Girls Trip to Disney. The prints are fun and most importantly- it works great. Easy to fold up and great little bag- that you can actually get it back in. We were stopped multiple times and asked where we got these!
customer_reviews.author: WFHMof3

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected.
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I wanted. Sturdy. Of course you will have to be careful. It's not super thick, but better then I expected. I've had it for a few months. I think as long as I am easy on the zipper, making sure it doesn't catch, it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Louise A. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: Better than an umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this poncho for the past week in moderately heavy wind and rain, and it has been a lifesaver. I watched people's umbrellas get blown out, or fly away, while I stayed nice and dry. It's also large enough to cover myself and my backpack, but compact enough when folded, to fit unobtrusively in my bag. The only issue is that the material seems fairly thin, so tears may become an issue of you get snagged on anything while wearing this.
customer_reviews.author: Monsieur Warui

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It's large enough to cover a medium sized backpack. With the backpack on, it still comes down past my waist in the back. I am six foot tall. The fabric is soft, and can lay flat to make a small tarp, Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Better than the $4 emergency poncho
customer_reviews.text: It finally rained so I got to test it a couple of times. Not bad. I'll need to see after a few more uses, but so far, so good. My only thing is I wish it had more than 1 snap under each arm to secure it further down. That seems to be the weak spot.
customer_reviews.author: S. Klepper

customer_reviews.title: Good Poncho for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Wore the poncho on a wet four day hike and it kept me and my gear dry the whole time. It also works good as a makeshift tarp or a dry place to sit down, or place your gear on the wet ground. I would recommend this poncho. They could improve the poncho by replacing the velcro with snaps and adding a few more locations, but this was a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Evans Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: My Scout used this during a wet Winter camp experience. Kept him dry and not too heavy where he felt like he was wrapped up in sweaty plastic. Good ventilation, yet waterproof. Folded down well after removal and use from pack. Would recommend. Single use and ready to take on more.
customer_reviews.author: CTIPAY

customer_reviews.title: Good poncho for the money
customer_reviews.text: Poncho seems to be made of good quality material. It’s big enough to cover your pack on rainy days. But not too big to where it drags the ground when just wearing it. The grommet holes can come in handy when needing a quick emergency shelter.
customer_reviews.author: DTA

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick, visor is not as long as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I used this much sooner than I thought I would, when we got some freak rains and flash flooding in San Diego of all places. Definitely kept my dry. The visor seems shorter than advertised. Might do better if you wear a baseball hand underneath. The neckline is a tad tight. Color looks great and it is very easy to fold it back up into the travel size cram bag it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Benjamin Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I liked how the product was advertised as shown and it really is convienient. However, when I got my product, there was a button missing for the arm hole. I hope the seller reads this review so I can get a replacement! But other than that, this poncho does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Yusuke Titmus

customer_reviews.title: Great for sightseeing in the rain
customer_reviews.text: This was great for a day walking around in a light rain. It would probably be good in a heavy rain also, but didn’t encounter that yet. I would recommend a baseball cap underneath to keep the peak of the hood out of your eyes. Material is lightweight but sturdy - definitely NOT one of those disposable ponchos. With care, I expect to use this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave TD

customer_reviews.title: Be Unbreakable and Dry
customer_reviews.text: Using this product to stay dry while my rain jacket is getting repaired. Works great as a poncho, and is large enough to protect a back pack. Admittedly I need to learn how to keep it close to my body as the wind can open the poncho up, but this may be par for the course with ponchos. The grommets do make this poncho cable of being used as a tarp, which I intend to test while camping, but have not done so yet with this product. The dark green color makes me feel like David Dunn from Unbreakable.
customer_reviews.author: C0sm0s82

customer_reviews.title: Goes over myself AND backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for backpacking trips to replace my rain pants and jacket. Big enough to go over me AND my pack. Not the highest quality material, but for the price I don't mind. Means I won't be upset when I tear this one up and need to get another.
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: 2lbs is not lightweight, bad seems
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality control, there's a tiny hole behind the reflective strip and the inside waterproof seal isn't even aligned with the seem (see pic). I ordered the one that also covers the pack. Weighs 2lbs and is as bulky as my outback duster..
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Anyoo Waterproof Rain Poncho
customer_reviews.text: Definitely needed to get a poncho & this one was perfect. Lightweight, comfortable & l like the zipper & addition Velcro to make sure your protected & hood stays on. Simple Poncho with improvements + comes in it’s own bag, you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Full coverage
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and I as we were fulfilling an item on his bucket list. We went to the Army/Navy football game in Philadelphia this fall. It forcasted rain for the whole game and there is nothing worse than being cold unless it is wet and cold. These were perfect! They fit over out warm coats and were long enough to cover our laps and legs. We lucked out that the second half the rain stopped and we were able to roll them up and put them back in their carry pouches. They now have a permanent place in our SUV so when it rains we can still enjoy being out in it.
customer_reviews.author: Beat Army

customer_reviews.title: Good considering the price!
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because my only problem with it is that the sleeves are awkwardly short so you still need to wear a waterproof jacket underneath if you don’t like wet wrists. I use it for horseback riding in the PNW
customer_reviews.author: Dan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A decent poncho
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light. Side snap to make something like a sleeve. Big enough to fit over a backpack. Won't rip on the first branch you scrap against, and if it does rip the rip stop fabric will keep it small so it can be easily fixed on the trail with duct tape. Rivits in the corners let you tie it out for a shelter. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Czarneski

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but snaps don't line up
customer_reviews.text: It's adequate for the price but the snaps on one don't line up and so leave gaps between them. I ordered two, and the other one didn't have that issue, so must be a quality control issue. Everything else is fine- it is very lightweight, so don't know how it will hold up to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Anyoo Waterproof Rain Poncho Lightweight Reusable Hiking Hooded Coat Jacket for Outdoor Activities
feature_bullets: Keep You Dry: Our Anyoo Unisex Adult Rain Poncho will keep you nice and dry, regardless of whether you are hillwalking or cycling. It is hooded with a cord adjuster to well protect your face, hook and loop fasteners along the sides ensures the perfect fit. Made of 210T ripstop nylon fabric + PVC coating, this rain poncho is PU3000MM waterproof. Each poncho is a piece of complete cloth which sewn together with the hood part. The overlock is well glued to prevent leaking.

Breathable and Comfortable: Don't worry that it will make you very hot because the arm holes & bottom are loose enough to allow air circulation.The display size of this poncho is 86" X 55". The size is large enough to cover up a backpack as well. It offers excellent freedom of movement, which makes it very comfortable to wear. You can adjust the hood and the side fasteners to suit your needs.

Lightweight and Packable: This unisex rain poncho from Anyoo gives you maximum coverage when you need it, plus easily folds into a compact size of 9 x 3 x 3 in. It can be stored away into the drawstring bag as a sort of emergency rain jacket and taken out and worn when needed. You can carry it around with you with ease saving you from carrying around a bulky raincoat. Weighs only approx. 10 oz in carry bag.

Durable and Resuable: Made from rip resistant nylon material, with thickened eyelets, the rain poncho offers better weather protection and are permanently water repellent and extremely resistant to abrasion and tearing. Prepare yourself for those unexpected downpours with this emergency rain poncho. A must-have for camping trips, festivals or days out.

Multi-use: A multi-function item has eyelets on the hem for use as a shelter or ground sheet, and hook & loop fasteners on the sides allowing you to use it as a sleeping bag cover. The fasteners allow "sleeves" to be formed so you can still handle equipment easily. Our Anyoo Unisex Adult Rain Poncho is perfect for the traveler, outdoor enthusiast, or for any outdoor activity with rain on the horizon.
